characters: THE WHOLE OFFICE EXPLODES IN LAUGHTER. COPS ARE ROLLING O
FOOTAGE OF THE LITTLE ROCK NINE
RON, FLIP, AND TRAPP WITH DEVIN DAVIS
ACACIA PARK. 12 PM. BRING CASE BOOK. AGENT Y
CONFEDERATES AND WHITE NATIONALISTS MARCHING, HOLDING UP
PHOTOS OF THE LYNCHING OF JESSE WASHINGTON
FELIX, WALKER AND CONNIE AT THE BACK DOOR, (RON'S POV)
JOIN THE COLORADO SPRINGS POLICE FORCE, MINORITIES ENCOUR
RON AND SGT. TRAPP WITH DEVIN DAVIS AT HIS DESK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scarlett O'Hara, played by Vivian Leigh, walks through th Thousands of injured Confederate Soldiers pulling back to reveal the Famous Shot of the tattered Confederate Flag i "Gone with the Wind" as The Max Stein Music Score swells Dixie to Taps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They say they may have lost the Battle but they didn't lose The War. Yes, Friends, We are under attack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shot on Grainy COLOR 16MM EKTACHROME Film, The NARRATOR BEAUREGARD, a Middle Aged but handsome, White Male, sits desk, a Confederate Flag on a stand beside him. Very Official. He is not a Southerner and speaks with articula and intelligence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've read about it in your Local Newspapers or seen it on The Evening News. That's right. We're living in an Era marked by the spread of Integration and Miscegenation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: being escorted into CENTRAL HIGH SCHOOL, Little Rock, Arkansas by The National Guard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Brown Decision forced upon us by The Jewish controlled Puppets on the U.S. Supreme Court compelling White children to go to School with an Inferior Race is The Final Nail in a Black Coffin towards America becoming a Mongrel Nation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Segregation Signs. Antebellum Photos. Happy Slaves in Old Movies. Masters inspecting their Cotton and Tobacco with their Slaves in The Fields. Blacks shining Shoes and work as Butlers, Porters and Maids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We had a great way of Life before The Martin Luther Coon's of The World...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Billboard of Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. sitting in th front row of a Classroom it reads: Martin Luther King in Communist Training School.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and their Army of Commies started their Civil Rights Assault on our Holy White Protestant Values.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you really want your precious White Child going to School with Negroes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Footage of Black and White Children playing together, innocent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beauregard now stands by a Large Screen and points at The Screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are Lying, Dirty Monkeys...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FOOTAGE and STILLS of Stereotype Blacks Coons, Bucks and shining Black Mammies. Black Soldiers in D. W. Griffith's "Birth of a Nation" pushing Whites around on the Street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Stopping at nothing to gain Equality with The White Man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Images and Scientific charts of Blacks compared to Apes a Monkeys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Rapists, Murderers...Craving The Virgin, Pure Flesh of White Women. They are Super Predators...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LYNCH, The MULATTO, lusting after our LILLIAN GISH in "Bi of a Nation." Other Lusting Images of Craving Black Beasts!!! SEXUAL PREDATORS!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KING KONG on Empire State Building with Fay Wray in his h GUS in "Birth of a Nation" chasing a White Woman he wants Rape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Stereotype illustration of Jews controlling Negroes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and the Negro's insidious tactics under the tutelage of High Ranking Blood Sucking Jews! Using an Army of outside...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beauregard continues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Northern Black Beast Agitators...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Footage of The March on Washington.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...determined to overthrow The God Commanded and Biblically inspired Rule of The White Race.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An image of an All-American White Nuclear Family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bouregard gives his Final Words.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's an International... Jewish... Conspiracy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WE HEAR and end with the Corny Stinger of Music that goes with these Education and Propaganda Films!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DRONE SHOT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Superimposed: Early 70s

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An amazing contrast. The beautiful landscape of Colorado Springs, the City sits nestled within the rugged Mountain terrain. The majestic Pikes Peak, the jagged beauty of Th Garden of the Gods, The plush Broadmoor Resort, The Will Rodgers Shrine of The Sun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RON STALLWORTH, Black, 21, Handsome, Intelligent, sportin good sized Afro, rebellious but straight laced by most 19 standards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron stares at an Ad attached to a bulletin board.

dialogues.speaker: JOIN THE COLORADO SPRINGS POLICE FORCE, MINORITIES ENCOUR
dialogues.text: TO APPLY! Ron rips the Ad from the board.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A drab, white-walled office. Ron sits across the table fr The Assistant City Personnel Manager, MR. TURRENTINE, Bla 40's, business like but progressive and CHIEF BRIDGES, Wh smart, 50's, in a Police Uniform, a Man ready for change.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why weren't you drafted into the Vietnam War?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I went to College.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you feel about Vietnam?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have mixed feelings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you call yourself a Womanizer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No Sir, I would not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you frequent Night Clubs?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No Sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you drink?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On Special occasions, Sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you ever done any Drugs?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only those prescribed by My Doctor, Sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turrentine looks at Chief Bridges.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's kind of rare these days for a young Hip Soul Brother like you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know but my Father was in The Military and I was raised up the Right way, Sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are you with people, generally?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, they treat me right, I treat them right, like I already said I was raised...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Have you ever had any negative...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Turrentine jumps in, impatient.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...What would you do if another Cop called you a Nigger?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would that happen...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Sheeeeeeettt!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bridges looks at him. Turrentine waits, Ron doesn't know to respond, finally. Turrentine leans forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's never been a Black Cop in this City. If we make you an Officer, you would, in effect, be the Jackie Robinson of the Colorado Springs Police force.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Turrentine lets this sink in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And if you know anything about Jackie Robinson you know he had to take a lot of... guff... from his fellow Teammates, from Fans, other Teams, and The Press.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know Jackie's Story, Sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. So, knowing that, when someone calls you Nigger will you be able to turn the other Cheek?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron evaluates the hard reality of the question. Decides.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I need to, yes, Sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Son, The Mayor and I think you might be The Man to open things up here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron looks at Chief Bridges.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll have your back but I can only do so much. The Weight of this is on You...and You alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron weighs The Journey ahead.  OMITTED  OMITTED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron sorts a file cabinet of records as OFFICER CLAY MULAN 60's, White, sits on a stool, reading a Magazine clearly looking at a Photo of something good. Ron looks at the Photo of the Actress Cybill Shepherd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cybill Shepherd. She was great in The Last Picture Show.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never saw it but what you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's a very good Actress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Y'know you want some of that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron ignores it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Truth be told when I see one of your kind with a White Woman it turns my Stomach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Why's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He could only want one thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What would that be?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You like acting dumb, Y'know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I just like my questions to be answered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A VOICE of UNIFORMED COP WHEATON calls from the other sid the Counter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! Anybody in there? Looking for a Toad here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron walks to the Counter to see The White and sleep-depri Cop impatiently leaning on his elbows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get me the record for this Toad named Tippy Birdsong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron pulls up the File for Tippy Birdsong. The Photo shows Black Man in his twenties.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While you're at it, why don't you grab another Toad... Steven Wilson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron pulls the File... another young Black Male, ANOTHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chief Bridges strides down the hall with SGT. TRAPP a sof spoken White Man in his 40's, they are discussing a File. suddenly appears walking with them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While I've got you both here. Sirs, I'd like to be an Undercover Detective.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chief Bridges and Sgt. Trapp both stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What Narcotics?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever Department works, Sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just joined The Force, Rookie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, Sir but I think I could do some good there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'm young. I think there's a niche for me. Get In where I can Fit In.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think, Chief?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sgt. Trapp sees the logic, looks to Chief Bridges, who st considering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think a lot of yourself, don't cha?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just trying to be of help, Chief. Plus, I hate working in The Records room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sgt. Trapp reacts knowing Ron shouldn't have said that ab the Records Room. CHIEF BRIDGES looks at Ron, matter of f

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I think Records is a good place for you to start, Rookie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chief, want me clean shaven?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep it. I like the look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chief Bridges walks off without another word. SGT. TRAPP gives a knowing look to Ron, who watches them walk away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron behind the Counter. MASTER PATROLMAN ANDY LANDERS, Wh Mid-30's, a regular guy but there is something dangerous there, steps up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Need a File on a Toad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron doesn't respond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You Deaf? I said I need info on a Toad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No Toads here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said, I don't have any Toads. I do have Human Beings and if you give me their names I can pull the Files.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landers scowls. Ron stares back at him, Eye to Eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heard you think you Hot Shit but you ain't nuthin' but a Cold Fart. Name's Maurice, Maurice Smalls...That respectful enough for you, Officer Toad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron pulls The File, throws it down on the Counter as Land snatches The File and storms off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Ron sleeps, a phone rings. Ron snaps awake and grabs a the phone on the night table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Bridges. You sleeping?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Chief, I was. Just worked a Night Shift.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I changed my mind, you're gonna come in a little earlier today. We've got an assignment for you. 12 Noon. Sharp. Narcotics Division. Wear Street clothes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes Sir, see you then. Thank You. Thank You.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron sits up in Bed, excited, thinking about the challenge ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron, dressed in Bell-Bottoms and a Hip Italian Knit Shirt Marshmallow Shoes steps inside the Narcotics office, whic literally The Basement of The Station. He looks around at Area Buzzing with Activity and sees

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: at their desks. Looking less like Cops and more like unke Hippies or Rock N' Rollers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: just stands there looking at all the activity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: waves Ron back to the rear of The Room for privacy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rookie, you're late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, it won't happen again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flip, late 30's, long hair, looks like anything but a Cop however is somewhat of a closed-off guy, all business, Ro sits across from him. Chief Bridges steps before them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got limited time so I'll be quick. That Black Radical Stokely Carmichael is giving a Speech Tonight at Bell's Nightingale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron is surprised at this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Nightclub?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Emmanuel Missionary Baptist Church!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flip just listens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carmichael is a former High Muckity- Muck with The Black Panthers and as far as I'm concerned, FBI Director J. Edgar Hoover was dead right when he said The Black Panthers are The Greatest Internal Threat to The Security of these United States. This Carmichael Joker, former Panther or not, they say he's a Damn Good Speaker and we don't want this Carmichael getting into The Minds of the Black People here in Colorado Springs and stirring them up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron's face cringes at Chief Bridges's words. He steps to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron, your assignment is to go to this Speech tonight and infiltrate these Bunch of Subversives and monitor The Audience reaction to Carmichael. You ready?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flip and Chief Bridges stare at Ron.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Born Ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron stands, his shirt off, as Flip wires a Wireless Transmitter and Microphone to his body. Another Narcotics Cop, JIMMY CREEK, 30's, observes the installation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any chance this thing Fucks Up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just stick to The Game Plan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Improvise. Like Jazz. This isn't some Big Bust. We just want some Intel, that's it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happens if someone offers you a Marijuana Cigarette?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean a Joint?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Soul Brother, I'm already High on Life. Can you Dig It?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And if someone pulls a Gun on you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron is caught off guard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You expecting that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flip pulls his Gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barrel of a 45's in your face, Finger on the Trigger, now what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blood, get that Gun out my face. Peace Love and Soul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gun is still in your face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron gives Jimmy a wary look speaking to Flip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I de-escalate. Talk calmly, firmly. Find a way out of there, A-Sap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy nods, satisfied. Flip is finished with The Wiring. takes a deep breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relax, we'll be outside, listening in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I order a Drink at The Bar?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flip steps away, no comment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's fine, just don't get Shit Faced.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got it. I'm gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy laughs, Slaps Ron on the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron pulls an unmarked Sedan to the curb. He gets out and looks around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Crowded sidewalk overflows into The Street, filling a l that Bottlenecks into The Club with the Sign:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron walks to the back of the line. He becomes an Every Brother slowly moving forward as People enter. As he move forward he notices a striking Woman at the Front Door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mid 20's, an Angela Davis Afro, she wears a Hip array of Militant wear, Black Leather Jacket, Love Beads but on he looks fantastic. Ron is taken by her Beauty, he watches a she monitors the door, clearly in charge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are you doing, my Soul Sista?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrice gives Ron a good look summing him up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm doing fine, my Brother. This is going to be an Amazing Night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indeed it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you heard Brother Kwame speak before?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kwame Ture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, I haven't, I didn't know he changed his name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, after he moved to Africa. He took the names of Kwame Nkrumah of Ghana and his Mentor Sekou Toure of Guinea to honor The Great Leaders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's Heavy. Do you know how he got to Colorado Springs?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Colorado College Black Student Union invited Brother Ture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can dig it. I can dig it. You with The Black Student Union?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm The President.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right On. Right On.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Club is PACKED, a Sea of Black Faces punctuated by an occasional White Face. Ron moves through The Crowd. He av direct Eye Contact, trying like Hell to act casual.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron steps to The Bar and signals The BARTENDER JABBO, 60' Black.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rum and Coke with Lime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Jabbo makes his Drink, something catches Ron's Eye. Patrice exits through a door with several Black Bodyguard

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron observes as a Tall figure comes out from Backstage wi Patrice, ODETTA and HAKEEM. The Tall figure hangs back covered by The Bodyguards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron on his feet, Black Fist in the air with The Crowd. Patrice on Stage with Kwame Ture with her Fist raised too The Shouting and Chanting finally cease, as Patrice speak

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Black Student Union of Colorado College is honored to bring The Vanguard of Revolutionaries fighting for The Rights of Black People all over The World. Let's show some Black Love to The One and Only, The Former Prime Minister of The Black Panther Party, The Brother Man with The Plan who's stickin'it to the Man, put your Hands together my People... for Our Kwame Ture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PANDEMONIUM! As Kwame Ture walks onto a small raised stag with Patrice. The entire place rises to their Feet, Fists Raised, Clapping, Shouting "Ungawa Black Power!" Ron watc as Patrice and Kwame hug. Patrice sits on Stage with Odet and Hakeem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kwame soaks in the Crowd's reaction, until...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you all for coming out tonight, My Beloved Sista's and Brotha's. I Thank you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: towering at Six Feet-Four with an infectious smile and Flawless Dark Skin, he's oozing Charisma out of every por He stands behind a small podium.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I'm here to tell you this evening it is time for you to stop running away from being Black. You are College Students, you should think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is time for you to understand that you as The growing Intellectuals of this Country, you must define Beauty for Black People, Now that's Black Power.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLACK POWER!!! BLACK POWER!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Black Students in The Audience are laser focused on h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is Beauty defined by someone with a Narrow Nose? Thin Lips? White Skin? You ain't got none of that. If your Lips are Thick, Bite them in. Hold your Nose! Don't drink Coffee because it makes you Black!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Audience laughs! Loving it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your Nose is Boss, your Lips are Thick, your skin is Black, you are Black and you are Beautiful!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone cheers including Ron!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We want to be like The White people that oppress us in this Country and since they hate us, we hate ourselves. You dig Tarzan? I remember that when I was a Boy I used to go see Tarzan Movies on Saturdays. I loved me some Jane too. Jane was A Fine White Woman. White Tarzan used to Beat up The Black Natives. I would sit there yelling "Kill The Beasts, Kill The Savages, Kill 'Em!" Actually I was saying: "Kill Me." It was as if a Jewish Boy watched Nazis taking Jews off to Concentration Camps and cheered them on. Today, I want The Chief to beat The Hell out of Tarzan and send him back to The Caves of Europe. But it takes time to become Free of The Lies and their shaming effect on Black Minds. It takes time to reject the most Important Lie: that Black People inherently can't do the same things White People can do unless White People help them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Audience laughing, overwhelmed, shouting back support ROAR from The Crowd. Ron finds himself clapping along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right on!!! Right On!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron looks around at everyone caught up in Kwame's spell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If a White Man wants to Lynch Me, that's his Problem. If he's got The Power to Lynch Me, that's My Problem. Racism is not a question of Attitude; it's a question of Power.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron is struck by the remark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The vast majority of Negroes in this Country live in Captive Communities and must endure their conditions of Oppression because and only because they are Black and Powerless. Now We are being shot down like Dogs in the streets by White Racist Police. We can no longer accept this Oppression without retribution. The War in Vietnam is Illegal and Immoral. I'd rather see a Brother Kill a Cop than Kill a Vietnamese. At least he's got a reason for Killing The Cop. When you Kill a Vietnamese you're a Hero and you don't even know why you Killed him. At least if you Kill a Cop you're doing it for a reason.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another Applause Break.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron listens, challenged, torn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kwame holds The Crowd in The Palm of his Hand. Members of Audience who were sitting already are rising to their Fee

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: sits, claps vigorously, as if forgetting he is Undercover

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In closing I know it's getting late, may I leave you Sista's and Brothers with these Last Words. "If I am not for myself, who will be? If I am for myself alone, who am I? If not now, when? And if not you, who?" We need an Undying Love for Black People wherever We may be. Good Night and POWER TO THE PEOPLE, POWER TO THE PEOPLE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BLACK MASS STANDS AS ONE WITH KWAME TURE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALL POWER TO ALL THE PEOPLE ALL POWER TO ALL THE PEOPLE ALL POWER TO ALL THE PEOPLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caught up in the moment, Ron gathers himself, as if remembering why he is here. Kwame takes Patrice's Hand an raises it in Celebration and Unity!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron moves down the Greeting Line for Kwame. He watches as Patrice stands near him. Kwame pulls her in close, whispe something in her ear. She smiles, a bit smitten.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron watches as he finally reaches Kwame, shaking his hand

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brother Ture, do you really think a War between The Black and White Race is inevitable?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kwame pulls Ron in close toward his face. Too close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flip and Jimmy wearing Headphones listening react to ear- splitting Audio feedback.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron stands mid-grip with Kwame. Nerves pinballing. Kwame lowers his voice, looking around conspiratorially.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brother, arm yourself. Get ready. The Revolution is coming. We must pick up a Gun and prepare ourselves...Trust me, it is coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kwame pulls back. Returns to his normal speaking voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you for your support, Brother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron is waiting outside as Patrice steps out, followed by Odetta and Hakeem. Ron nears her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what you have planned now but maybe I could buy you a Drink?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm waiting for Brother Kwame, I have to make sure he gets back safely to the Hotel and he's squared away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can dig it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron starts to walk away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe, if it's not too late, I'll meet you at The Red Lantern. You know where that is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I'll see you then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cool. All Power to All The People.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Black folks are dancing, getting down. At the bar, Ron lo at his watch having been there a while. He finishes his R and Coke with Lime watching the door open but it is not Patrice. He decides to call it a Night, stepping off his stool, paying his Tab to BRO POPE, The Bartender when...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry I'm late...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrice is right there near him. She flops down on the Ba stool, exhausted, and lights up a Kool Cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...You won't believe what happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrice says to Bro Pope, The BARTENDER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bro Pope, Seven and Seven, please... The Pigs pulled us over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, they knew Brother Kwame was in Town. Made us get out the Car. Pigs pulled us over for no reason. Total harassment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: True?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Truth. Do Four Dogs have Four Assholes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrice's Car is pulled over and a Uniformed Cop gets out Squad Car revealing Master Patrolman Landers. He instruct them all with his hand on his Revolver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're tired of Police Brutality. We're tired of Police Murdering Black Folks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right everybody out the vehicle. Now!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kwame, Patrice, Hakeem, and Odetta climb out of the vehic Landers pushes Kwame against the Car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't wanna see nuthin' but Black Asses and Black Elbows. Spread 'em!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kwame, Patrice, Hakeem and Odetta are all Spread Eagle against the Car. Master Patrolman Landers pats them down. Another Police Cruiser pulls up. TWO MORE COPS, SHARPE an CINCER, both White 50's, get out and observe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes Extra Time patting down Patrice getting some "Groping" in for Good Measure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Search The Car. I know these Niggers are holding something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cincer and Sharpe enter Patrice's Car, searching it. Land turns Kwame around, facing him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You that so called Big Shot Panther Nigger aren't you? Heard you was in Town, Stokely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My Name is Kwame Ture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landers stares him down for a moment. You think he's gonn slug him but he thinks better. The other Cops go through Car searching, throwing things around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you Black Bastards are holding. What you got in there some Weed, Pills, Heroin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrice, Kwame, Odetta, and Hakeem and the others just st back, silent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's clean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing more to say. Landers gets in Patrice's Face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You get this Black Panther outta' Colorado Springs before Sunrise. Hear ME??? Or you all go to Jail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Black people were Born in Jail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrice at the Bar with Ron, he is stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you see the Officer's names?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know I should have but the whole thing was so frightening... I didn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bro Pope, The Bartender sets the Drink down. Patrice take gulp, her hand shaking. Ron observes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrice nods, pulls herself together. Ron looks at her, softly touches her on her back, trying to comfort, thinki to himself, torn in many directions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was the Room like?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Folks were hanging on every word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds like he had them pretty riled up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I'm not sure that means Black Folks were ready to start a Revolution.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What makes you think that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody was talking about that. That wasn't the Mood. Everybody was Cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So let me get this straight. He told a Crowd of "Black Folks" to get ready for a Race War. That they were going to have to arm themselves and kill Cops. What about that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, he said that but I think that was just talk. You know, Rhetoric.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I thought too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank God, Carmichael has left Colorado Springs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kwame Ture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He changed his name from Stokely Carmichael to Kwame Ture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chief Bridges humored by as if he is suppose to care.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care if he changed his name to Muhammad Ali, he's still dangerous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chief Bridges starts to leave the room. Ron decides to sa it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you hear the Story Patrice told me about how the CSPD pulled over her and Ture?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chief Bridges stops, drinks in the question. Everything g silent. He then gives Ron a deliberate look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. We didn't hear that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From Chief Bridges's look, Ron knows he did. Jimmy, Flip stare at Ron. A Big White Elephant in the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrice. Isn't she the one from The Black Student Union? They brought Too- Ray in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kwame Ture, Correct.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You getting pretty Chummy with her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If Ron pushes it more he knows it will go bad. He drops i

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just doing my job, Chief. Undercover.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah and it better not be Under the Cover Of The Sheets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flip and Jimmy chuckle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would never jeopardize a Case...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... you don't know what you would do, you just got here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron takes this in. Dejected.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rookie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron nods, appreciative.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron, let's take a walk.  OMITTED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chief Bridges and Ron walk down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm transferring you into Intelligence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What will I be doing, Chief?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chief Bridges stops and looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Intelligence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chief Bridges walks off. Ron stands there,Jacked!!!  OMITTED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron at his desk in The Intelligence Office in Street Clot among his COLLEAGUES. He sips Lipton Tea with Honey and looking through various Publications. He then picks up Th Colorado Springs Gazette Newspaper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE - Classifieds section of the Newspaper. In the bott right corner, in small print:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSER - Ku Klux Klan - For Information, Contact 745-1209 Ron thinks a moment. Then grabs the phone. Dials. After a few Rings, a Pre-Recorded Message Pops On:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have reached The Colorado State Chapter of The Ku Klux Klan. Please leave a message... God Bless White America.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a BEEP...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, this is Ron Stallworth calling. Saw your Advertisement in The Colorado Springs Gazette. I'm interested in receiving some Reading Materials. My Phone Number is 403- 9994. Looking forward to you returning my call. God Bless White America.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flip at another Desk spins around looking at Ron like he 3 Heads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did I just hear you use your Real Name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Motherfucker!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, Motherfuckin' Amateur Hour. What were you thinkin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RING!!! RING!!! Ron's Phone. Flip and Ron stare at it. Fl gestures to answer it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wasn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You dialed. Pick it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RING! RING! Ron looks at the ringing phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PICK IT UP!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Ron Stallworth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the Receiver, a Gravelly, Secretive Voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Walter. Returning your call... From The Organization.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Organization?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Well we appreciate your interest. So what is your Story, Ron?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron looks around. Shrugs. Might as well do it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since you asked- I Hate Niggers, Jews, Mexicans, Spics, Chinks but especially those Niggers and anyone else that does not have pure White Aryan Blood running through their Veins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All Heads in the Unit turn toward Ron.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In fact, my Sister, Pamela, was recently accosted by a Nigger...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron is snarling now, every ounce of his Voice projecting White Supremacist Hate. He is utterly convincing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Is that so?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Every time I think about that Black Baboon putting his Filthy Black Hands on her White as Pure Driven Snow Body I wanna Puke!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence on the other end of The Line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're just the kind of Guy we're looking for. Ron, when can we meet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flip, Jimmy and all the other White Undercover Cops are Rolling their Eyes. Stepping away, shaking their heads. S wanting to laugh but DON'T.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about Friday night? After I get off work?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other Cops are losing their minds, Quietly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deal! I'll get back to you with details. Take care, Buddy Boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking forward to meeting you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron looks around. Everyone in the Unit is standing around desk. All White Faces. Looking on, astonished.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good Luck Ron with your New Redneck Friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Undercover Gang Cracks Up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron is facing Sergeant Trapp, who sits at his desk, Jaw h slightly open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They want you to join The Klan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... they want to meet me First.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They want to meet you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll need another Undercover to go in my place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... you probably shouldn't go to that meeting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone has a Chuckle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'd have to go to Narcotics. Meaning we'd have to deal with Bridges.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn. OMITTED  OMITTED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A spacious office, its walls brimming with Books. Chief Bridges sits behind a wooden desk, his gaze thoughtful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't spare any Men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've looked over the Logs and it seems you can spare them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sgt. Trapp, Ron spoke to the Man on the phone. When they hear the Voice of one of my Guys, they'll know the difference.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why so, Chief?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Want me to spell it out? He'll know the difference between how a White Man talks and a Negro.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does a Black Man talk like?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron, I think what The Chief is trying to say is...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...If you don't mind, I'd like to talk for myself, Thank You. How exactly does a Black Man talk?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know... YOU KNOW!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chief, some of us can speak King's English and Jive. I happen to be fluent in both.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron, how do you propose to make this Investigation?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have established contact and created some familiarity with The Klansmen over the phone. I will continue that role but another Officer, a White Officer, will play Me when they meet Face to Face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...My Point Exactly!!!...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron continues talking to Chief Bridges.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Black Ron Stallworth on The phone and White Ron Stallworth Face to Face, so there becomes a combined Ron Stallworth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I believe we can... With The Right White Man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron steps outside and Chief BRIDGES follows him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If anything happens to my Man there won't be Two Ron Stallworths. There'll be none.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron walks in on Flip and Jimmy looking at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. It won't happen again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard that somewhere before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Jimmy when's the last time they let a Rookie head up an Investigation. Oh that's right, NEVER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron ignores the slight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we move on to the Bio, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Ron Stallworth. I do Wholesale Manufacturing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whereabout?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flip sighs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pueblo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that commute like?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy, I'm glad you asked, straight- shot down I-25. Hour tops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Long ride.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do we listen to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KWYD. Christian Talk in The Morning, although the Signal starts to cut out near Pueblo. On the way back I go for 102.7 to get my Allman Brothers Fix. Only I have to change every time that British Fag David Bowie pipes on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love Bowie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember you've got to retain the details of what you share with them so I can be White Ron Stallworth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy, I always wanted to grow up to be Black, all my Heroes were Black Guys. Willie Mays...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Basket catch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wilt The Stilt...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A record hundred points in the game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But my favorite is O.J.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Love Fuckin' O.J. Orenthal James Simpson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, don't share your Love of The Brothers with these Guys. For you, it's The Osmonds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I get to play you but you don't get to play me. Jimmy, does that sound fair?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fair? I get to play you and Jimmy and all the other guys in the Station... Everyday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flip doesn't understand, he looks at Jimmy. Both befuddle

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you meeting?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter Breachway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Become Walter's Friend, get invited back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at you. Is that it, Sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm on the phone with The Klan, You see them in person...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...And you need to sound like my voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh Boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just repeat after me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron hands out a piece of paper to Flip and Jimmy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Godfather.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look a'here, some people say we got a lot of malice. Some say it's a lotta nerve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look a'here, some people say we got a lot of malice. Some say it's a lotta nerve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw we won't quit moving 'Til we get what we deserve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw we won't quit moving 'Til we get what we deserve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've been buked and we've been scorned. We've been treated bad, talked about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've been buked and we've been scorned. We've been treated bad, talked about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Just as sure as you're born But just as sure as it take.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Just as sure as you're born But just as sure as it take.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two eyes to make a pair, huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two eyes to make a pair, huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brother, we can't quit until we get our share.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brother, we can't quit until we get our share.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say it loud. I'm Black and I'm proud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say it loud. I'm Black and I'm proud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy, join us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say it loud. I'm Black and I'm proud. Say it loud. I'm Black and I'm proud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All 3 Fall OUT - DIE LAUGHING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't forget to lose that Star of David around your neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron shoots Flip a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're Jewish?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron and Jimmy sit in an Unmarked Car. Several yards away, Flip stands in The Lot, leaning up against a Pick Up Truc

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron watches through Binoculars as a Beat-Up, Ivory-colore Pickup Truck pulls in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BINOCULARS POV: from the Truck's license plate to a Confederate Flag Bumper Sticker that reads WHITE POWER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Walter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron writes down The Truck's Plate

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Number: CLOSE - KE-4108.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A White Male, FELIX, 30's, steps out of The Pickup Truck. wears Corduroy Pants, Uncombed Hair to his Neck and a Fu Manchu. He pulls on a cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron Stallworth?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's me. And you must be Walter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Name's Felix.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was told I'd be meeting with Walter Breachway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Change of plans, Mack. I'm gonna need you to hop in The Pickup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even with his slouched shoulders, Felix towers over Flip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, well how about I just follow you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...No Can Do. You come with me. Security.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron and Jimmy each wear Headphones, listening in. They lo at each other...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flip glances in the direction of Ron's Car, then pulls op the rusty passenger door of Felix's Pickup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Pickup flies past. Ron and Jimmy are behind and gaini

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Felix adjusts his Rear-View Mirror. Eyes it suspiciously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You for The White Race, Ron?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell Yeah!!! Been having some trouble lately with these Local Niggers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since The Civil War it's always trouble with Niggers. Walter said something about your Sister?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Makes me Sick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Pickup speeds up, increasing the distance between the vehicles. Ron's car accelerates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flip eyes Ron's Car in the Side-View mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it's also the, like, camaraderie I'm looking for...with The Klan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Da Fuck did you say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Camaraderie...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. The other word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Klan...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Not "The Klan." It's The Organization. The Invisible Empire has managed to stay Invisible for a reason. Do Not Ever Use That Word. You understand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I overstand... Right. The Organization.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An uncomfortable silence. Felix leers into the Rear-View mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Check this Shit out... you're never gonna believe it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a Jig on our Bumper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flip Freezes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sees us. Back Off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron eases on the Gas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One hand on The Steering Wheel, Felix opens The Glove compartment in front of Flip's knees and grabs a Box of Ammunition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's be ready, case we gotta go and shoot us A Alabama Porch Monkey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tosses The Box onto Flip's lap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look under your seat. Pull it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pull out what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Felix snaps his finger at Flip, who jumps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Under the seat!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flip reaches to his Feet. Pulls out a SAWED-OFF SHOTGUN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Load 'er up. One in The Chamber.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flip is hesitant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Load it!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flip dutifully opens up The Box. Pulls out a Shell. Loads into The Chamber and pulls the action forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ready to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Felix eyes The Rear-View Mirror again. Ron's Car has drif much farther back. Felix puffs away at his Cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right, Porch Monkey. Don't be Messin' with us...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...The Organization.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not so fast, Buddy Boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Felix's Pickup turns into The parking lot of A Confederat Bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eyeing The Truck, Ron and Jimmy breathe a sigh of relief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a Bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron drives past the lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think he got a good look at My Face?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Probably.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Cramped and Unfriendly Dive. LOW-LIFES mill about. The filled with Dense Smoke. Pool Balls CRACK-SMACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Felix leads Flip to The Bar Area, where WALTER BREACHWAY, White Male, 30's, stands. Walter is affable by nature, Sh and Stocky, with a Crew Cut and small Mustache.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron. Glad you could make it. Walter Breachway, Chapter President.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They shake hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I appreciate you inviting me out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Felix lingers like a Bad Smell. Beside him a Drunk Man, IVANHOE 20's, gives Flip The Stink Eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been impressed with our phone conversations. I feel you have some fine ideas that could help The Cause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I meant every word I said.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flip's a Natural.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How 'bout some pool?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ivanhoe hands Flip a Pool Stick and gathers the Balls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've had my own share of Run-Ins with Niggers. Matter of fact, it's part of what led me to The Organization.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It became my salvation. After I was shot and wounded by some Niggers. My Wife... Savagely Raped by a whole Pack of 'EM, and not a one went to Jail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flip nods, expertly feigning sympathy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron and Jimmy each wear Headphones, listening in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron cracks a smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter and Flip continue to play pool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're taking over. That's all you see on the TV Anymore. Niggers. Niggers selling Soap, Niggers selling Automobiles, Niggers selling Toothpaste, Niggers, Niggers, Niggers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wasn't long ago them Sumbitches wasn't on no TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You forgetting Uncle Ben and Aunt Jemima.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dang!!! You know, I gotta say I kinda like dem' Niggers...Rice and Pancakes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ivanhoe shakes hands with Flip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Name's Ivanhoe, by the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mad at Sanford and Son and Flip Wilson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All you get now is how we gotta' cater to them. We gotta' get us some "Minorities". Watch ya' mouth, don't say this, don't say that, be nice, they're not Colored...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Negros...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Blacks...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Afro-Americans...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...FUCK. How 'bout just Fuckin'? Niggers. Make it Fuckin' simple.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NIGGERS!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I been saying this stuff for years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ain't the only one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know how good it is to hear someone that gets it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flip looks around. Gets quiet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kinda stuff you Guys do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ivanhoe swigs his Beer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, Cross burnings. Marches and stuff so people don't Fuck wit' us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm tired of people Fuckin' with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You come to the right place cuz' Nobody Fucks with us. How much you know about The History?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some...I could know more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll teach you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This year's gonna be big for us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How so?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ivanhoe moves in closer. Balls his hand in a fist, then o it quickly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOOM!!! We're gonna make Fireworks, yes we are...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter swoops in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Ivanhoe talking nonsense again. Kid can't hold his Beer fer Shit. The Organization is strictly Non- Violent...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Like dat Dead Nigger Martin Luther Coon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gotcha.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flip looks down at his Shirt -- the Top Button has flappe off again. The next button would mean The End. CURTAINS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He quickly buttons it. Then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say, Ron? Mind coming with me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You Undercover or something? You ask too many questions. Let's GO!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind Walter, Felix is Laser-Focused on Flip's every mov Flip sees it. Walter points to a door. Flip walks forward with Walter, Ivanhoe, and Felix tailing from behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where they going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron's Face falls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lost the damn signal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Men move single-file through the door, Flip first. It small room, with a wooden table and some rickety chairs. lone white light bulb hangs from above.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Congrats you passed The Mustard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter exchanges uneasy looks with Felix.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thought we'd get the Membership process started.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flip can breathe again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now we're talkin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter hands Flip a stack of papers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fill these out and Mail 'em to The National Headquarters. Once they send your Membership Card, you'll be able to participate in our Programs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flip sings The Alcoa Jingle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alcoa Can't wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like those Commercials.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Imperial Tax to become a Member: Ten Dollars for The Year. Fifteen Dollar Chapter Fee. Robes and Hoods not included, that's Extra.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuckin' Inflation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flip shakes hands with all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't thank you Brothers enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pleasure, is all ours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Felix and Ivanhoe give polite nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take you back to your Car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Flip turns to leave...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not a Jew, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flip stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You trying to offend me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flip turns to Walter: you believe this Shit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Protocol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All eyes on Flip. His face flares with rage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Course I'm no Stinkin' Kike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We gotta ask it, is all. I'm satisfied. How about you Guys?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ivanhoe nods. Felix just stares.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smells Kosher to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop fuckin' 'round.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Felix, cut it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron helps Flip rip The Wire off his Chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have me dressed like one of the Beverly Hillbillies for Chrissakes. I felt too Redneck for those Guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They liked you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Except for that Felix Guy. Do not ride his Bumper like that! Two car lengths!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got The Papers? They want you to join.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Technically they want you to join.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They want a Black Man to join The Ku Klux Klan. I'd call that Mission Impossible. Double Success.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sgt. Trapp sits at his desk, thumbing through The Report. and Flip stand across from him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And exactly how much should we be worrying about them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enough that we'd like to dig deeper. One of the Men discussed plans for a possible Attack...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I wouldn't give him that much credit. These Yahoos like to Boast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of Attack?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron looks to Flip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ivanhoe said "BOOM", mentioned something about Fireworks. Personally, I didn't buy it. Doubt they're even capable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sgt. Trapp bridges his hands together, contemplating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Either way, we're looking for full support from The Department.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're moving on with the Investigation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron just stares at Trapp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron and Patrice seated across from each other, already eating. Patrice's attire more lax, but still in her Black Leather Jacket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The next day when we dropped Brother Kwame off at the Airport he told me The Black Power Movement needed Strong Sistah's like me to lead the fight against Capitalist oppression and The Politicians and Pigs who perpetuate it. His words almost made that whole Pig Nightmare worth while...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron goes Mute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't really use that word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What word?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pigs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What else would you call them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cops... Police...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bunch of Racist Cops on a Power Trip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you think all Cops are Racist?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It only takes One to pull a Trigger on a Innocent Sister or Brother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrice absorbs all of this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why were you at Brother Kwame's Speech?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's got some good ideas. I don't agree with all of them but he's a smart Brother who's worth hearing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you Down for The Liberation of Black People?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do we always have to talk about Politics?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's more important?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you ever take any time off from The Liberation of Black People?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NO!!! It's a Lifetime JOB!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron reaches across the table and takes Patrice's Hand. Patrice pulls her Hand back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sista Angela Davis, can we spend some quality time together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what did you say your J-O-B is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kathleen Cleaver, I didn't?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are You A Pig?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean A Cop?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You A Cop?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NO I'm a Black Man who wants to get to know A Strong, Intelligent, Beautiful Sister.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron tries to kiss Patrice but she moves her head away. Th finish their meal in silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's late. Ron is the only Officer working, filling out a Police Report and sipping a mug of Hot Lipton Tea with Ho Suddenly... The Undercover Line rings. Ron freezes. Picks the line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Ron.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Walter. Is this Ron? Your Voice sounds different over The Phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron has to THINK FAST.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Allergies acting up again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A steady Beat of Silence on The Line. Then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Yeah, I get that all the time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron waits for the response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, just thought I'd say it was great having you swing by. The Brothers really took a liking to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron squeezes his fist. Victory. Trying to stay nonchalant

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm honored.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you come by Felix's this Saturday? Meet the rest of The Brotherhood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sgt. Trapp and Ron walk and talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got a friend that's up with these Groups. He says they're moving away from the Ole Violent Racist Style. That's what Davis is peddling now, it's become Mainstream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Davis?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Devin Davis current Grand Wizard of The Klan, always in a three piece suit, he now goes by National Director. He's clearly got his Sights on Higher Office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Political Office? How so?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I guess they're trying to move away from their History of Selling HATE...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Keep going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Affirmative Action, Immigration, Crime, Tax Reform. He said no one wants to be called a Bigot anymore. Archie Bunker made that too Un-Cool. The idea is under all these issues, everyday Americans can accept it, support it, until eventually, one day, you get somebody in The White House that embodies it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: America would never elect somebody like Devin Davis President of the United States of America?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sgt. Trapp just stares at Ron for a long moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For a so called Black Man, you're pretty naive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron is in his unmarked Car in a Middle Class Neighborhood pulls on Headphones and looks out his Window where...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A manicured yard. Pristine. A very Green Healthy lawn. A sign: AMERICA LOVE IT OR LEAVE IT! Flip rings The Doorbel The Screen Door is opened by CONNIE, White Woman, 30's, Proper and Good-Looking. A Gold Cross dangles from her Ne

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron! So nice to meet you. I'm Connie, Felix's Wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Connie hugs him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great to meet you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Boys are in the Backyard.  OMITTED  OMITTED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron shakes his head listening to The Transmitter, taking notes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Klan Members seated, some on folding chairs. Connie enters The Backyard with an Appetizer Platter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry to interrupt. I have some Cheese Dip and Crackers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They dig in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks Honey. Felix turns to The Brothers. Klansmen Feed off The Energy

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make 'em remember who We Are and What We Stand For. We are The Organization.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I read in The Gazette some Nigger named Carmichael held a Rally and there's some College Nigger Girl with the "Baboon Student Union" attacking Our Police. This Girl is Dangerous. Reminds me of that Commie Angela Davis. We need to shut her damn mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Men exchange uneasy looks - Why is Connie in Men's Business?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here, I clipped the Article.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Connie pulls The Article from her apron. Hands it to Feli Felix eyes it, focused on an image of Kwame and without looking up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That'll be all. Love you Sweetie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of these days you're going to need me to do something for you. Wait and See.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Connie trudges back towards the house without answering. Felix hands The Clipping to The Klansmen, who pass it aro the room. When it reaches Walter, he sets it down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How 'bout We focus on our Bread and Butter. The Next Cross Burning. Which, Flip, you'll be lucky enough to participate in if your Membership Card comes soon enough...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...That'd be a tremendous Honor. Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Highest Hills get the most Eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter looks for approval. Nods all around. Felix rises, balance uncertain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Ron, I gotta show you something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Felix plops a Hand on Flip's Back. Flip rises.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron takes in The Audio. He records more Notes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flip, Felix, and Walter walk downstairs to the Den.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Felix flips on the lights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looka here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Various Guns adorn The Walls -- Rifles, Shotguns, Handgun Pinned on The Far Wall: White Supremacist Memorabilia including a Magazine Cut-Out of KKK Grand Wizard Devin Da

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow. This is really... something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Felix pulls a rusted Double-Barreled Shotgun off The Rack

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's my favorite. Twelve Gauge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Felix smirks and points The Two Barrels at Flip's chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I call this...The Jew Killer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flip Freezes. Felix's Finger Rests on The Trigger. Teasin Seriously? Felix stares, challenging Flip to make a Move. Move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a Remington Model 1900.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long Beat. Then: Felix smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indeed it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Felix places the Shotgun back on the rack. Walter outside Door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Almost done in here? We still have some items on The Agenda...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Not just yet. Gotta make sure there's no Jew in him. Flip keeps quiet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on Man, this is just Straight-Up Offensive. We're talking about someone who's gonna be our Brother in a couple months. Is there a fuckin' Star of David around his Neck? Does Ron got a YA-MA-KA on his HEAD for Pete's sake?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just Protocol. My House, My Rules.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Felix sets a hand on Flip's Back, guiding him past Walter

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where...uh...where ya takin' me? I told you already I'm not thrilled with you callin' me a Jew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tough Titty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter follows as Felix leads Flip into the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take a seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Felix sets Flip down on a chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Felix, it ain't necessary, Man. This is how we lose recruits!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Felix pushes Walter backward, through and out The Den doo He slams The Door closed and locks it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this your Jew Den? This where you make your Candles? Lamp shades?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Felix opens a Desk Drawer and takes out a POLYGRAPH MACHI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you're going to take this Lie Detector test.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns the ignition and drives forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Felix sets The Polygraph in front of Flip. Urgent knockin the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open up, Felix! Enough is Enough!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lower your Arm right here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Felix, this is lame bullshit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lame or not you're taking this Jew Lie Detector Test.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Felix reaches in and lowers his Arm for him, then slides Blood Pressure cuff over Flip's Arm. Flip rips it off, ju up, knocking the chair over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out of respect, I'm gonna play along with your Get Smart Bullshit, but I'm No Fuckin' Jew!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter persistently bangs on The Door. Felix pulls out a Shiny Pistol from his belt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Siddown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gun in hand, Ron crouches beside the Unmarked car, parked the curb near Felix's House. He notices a NEIGHBOR taking The Trash. Ron puts his Gun away. His Eyes are on THE LOO OUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flip sits in The Chair as Felix sticks Electrodermal Sens on Flip's hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ask anybody, they'll say I'm a real Friendly Guy. Thing is, I'm only Friendly to my Friends, not JEW Friendly, Damn Sure not Nigger Friendly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter is still banging away at the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me in!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
