dialogues.text: Felix tightens The Blood Pressure Cuff on Flip's arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's warm up. What is the surname of your Biological Father?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stallworth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me see your Dick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flip starts to unzip his pants and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You like pretty Dicks Felix?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hear you Jews do something Funny with ya Dicks. Some weird Jew Shit. Is your Dick circumstanced?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You tryin' to suck my Jew Dick? Faggot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who you callin' a Faggot, Jew?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Y'know what I think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think a lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think this Holocaust stuff never happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the biggest Jewish Conspiracy. 8 Million Jews killed? Concentration camps? Never happened. Where's the proof?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WE SEE on Flip's face, despite him trying to fight hard t affected, he is not that good an Actor. Marlon Brando couldn't do it either.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you High?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't get High. I drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haven't seen the Footage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fake. Jews run Hollywood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron bolts onto Felix's Front Lawn, unsure what to do but knowing that he GOTTA DO something. Ron picks up a Flower and CHUCKS IT -- CRASH! It goes straight through the Kitc Window, shattering The Glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Connie SCREAMS! Through the window pane, she can see the backside of Ron -- a Black Man wearing a faded denim jack Ron is "Low Running" now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a Fuckin' Black Lawn Jockey on our Green Lawn!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Felix storms out of The Den. Flip rips off The Polygraph Sensors and follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All of The Klan Members, including Flip and Connie, pour the Lawn. Felix bursts out of The Front door with his Pis He Fires at Ron -- who is USAIN BOLT-ING down The Street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flip grabs Felix's pistol and FIRES just as Ron reaches t unmarked car. Flip fires again and again emptying the gun Missing on purpose just as Ron reaches The Unmarked car. jumps inside... SQUEEEEEL! The Car peels off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, keep drivin' you Black Spearchucker!!! Piece a Shit Nigger!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Almost got 'im.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flip is Foaming at The Mouth. Everyone stares at him, momentarily surprised at his outburst. Flip hands Felix h Gun back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Felix, you still want me to take your Jew Detector Test!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter looks from Flip to Felix. Felix can only shrug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neighbors poke their heads out from across The Street. Fe looks to The Chapter Members gathered around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody go Home NOW!!! Get Outta HERE!!! GO HOME!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron speeds away, down The Residential Streets. He looks d at his Body. No wounds. He slows his breathing. Too Close COMFORT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sgt. Trapp flips through The Report. Ron and Flip watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lie Detector? Shots Fired? A Goddamn ClusterFuck!!! You Dickheads are putting me in a Tough Spot here. If Bridges heard about this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he gonna hear about it, Sarge?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sgt. Trapp thinks a moment, then opens a drawer under his desk and throws The Report into it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron and Flip emerge from Sgt. Trapp's office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't say it in there with Trapp but that Peckerwood had a Gun in my Face and he was an Ass Hair away from pulling The Trigger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he didn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he could have and then I woulda been Dead... for what? Stoppin' some Jerkoffs from playing Dress up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flip, it's Intel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not risking my Life to prevent some Rednecks from lighting a couple Sticks on Fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the Job. What's your problem?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron, you're my problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For you it's not a job, it's a Crusade. It's not personal nor should it be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stop walking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why haven't you bought into this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why should I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because you're Jewish, Brother. The So-Called Chosen People. Flip gets pissed and flies up into Ron face. They are nos nose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're passing, Man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're passing for a WASP!!! White Anglo Saxon Protestant, All-American Hot Dog, Cherry Pie White Boy. It's what some Light-Skinned Black Folks do, they pass for White.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flip understands now. He glares at Ron.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doesn't that Hatred The Klan say Piss you off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course it does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then why you acting like you ain't got skin in the Game!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's my Damn Business!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's our Business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron and Flip look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna get your Membership Card so you can go on this Cross Burning and get in deeper, right Flip?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron is alone on the phone as he studies his packet of KKK materials. He sees a number for the KKK Headquarters. He dials. A Message clicks on:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wake up White Man, The Negro wants your White Woman and your Job! The Jew wants your Money...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Recording is interrupted by a PLEASANT-SOUNDING MAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, and whom am I talking to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good afternoon. My name is Ron Stallworth, calling from Colorado Springs. How are you today, Sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quite well, Ron. What can I do for you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm calling because I desperately want to participate in my Chapter's Honorary Events but I can't until I receive my Membership Card.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course, I can help you with that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. Who am I speaking with?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Devin Davis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron has Died and gone to Heaven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry... did you just say you're Devin Davis?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Last time I checked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Grand Wizard of The Ku Klux Klan? That Devin Davis?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That Grand Wizard and National Director.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? National Director too?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm honored to be speaking with you. I'm not afraid to say it...I consider you a True White American Hero.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are there any other kind?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEVIN DAVIS 30's has a trim Red Mustache and a mop of San Hair which drapes his ears. He plays the role of a Southe Gent but his piercing pale-Blue Eyes reveal a Monster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Davis wears a Three-Piece Suit and sits at a neat Office Desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I'm just happy to be talking to a True White American.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amen, Mr. Davis. Seems like there's less and less of us these days. Now about that Membership Card...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Davis unwraps a stick of Juicy Fruit Gum, his favorite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I understand the situation. We've been having some Administrative problems that have caused a backlog. ...Tell you what, Ron. I'll see to it personally that your Membership Card is processed and sent out today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Mr. Davis. I can't express to you how much I appreciate this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pleasure is all mine. I look forward to meeting you in person One Day and God Bless White America.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron rushes out of the room buzzing about speaking to Davi immediately KNOCKS shoulders with someone going the other way. When he turns around it's... Master Patrolman Lander who turns back giving a smirk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch where you're going. You could get hurt like that Hot Shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landers marches on leaving Ron to contemplate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron wires up Flip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That Cop that pulled Kwame Ture over that night... was it Landers?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flip is surprised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can smell em' a Mile away now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flip ponders for a moment, then says.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's been a Bad Cop for a long time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does that kinda' Shit all the time. Few years ago, he allegedly Shot and Killed a Black Kid... he said he had a Gun. The Kid wasn't the type.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flip, why do you tolerate this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're a family. Good or Bad. We stick together. You wanna be the Guy that Rats him out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron goes quiet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're New. You're a Rookie. You ever get your Ass in a Jam, you'll appreciate The Blue Wall of Silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, reminds me of another Group.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron finished. Flip steps away buttoning his shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POP! A Bullet strikes a Beer Bottle in an Open Field.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullseye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Felix looks up from his Shotgun. All around him, other Chapter Members line up in a row, firing their Guns at Bottles. Some are wearing Green Army Field Jackets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nearby, a couple of fold-up tables stocked with plates of Grilled Meat and Bowls of Cheese Doodles. Flip is locked conversation with Walter, who could not care less about t Firing Range behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and then you got what used to be a decent Bar, The Hide N Seek Room, turned into a Filthy Fag Bar overnight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuckin' Fags everywhere these days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flip is still mostly focused on Felix and his crew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're trying to Colonize. First they get their own Bars, then they want Equal Treatment...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Forget Dem Fags... Some of these Guys Army-trained?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter turns around for a moment, then turns back, dismissive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lot of 'em are. Fort Carson...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: observes TWO MYSTERY MEN, STEVE and JERRY, both 30's, the look classier than the rest of The Gang handling M-16's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've not seen those Macs before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve and Jerry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, who are they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's classified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter steps away leaving Flip to ponder the Two Mystery

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron is in the Car quite a ways away with a huge Telephoto lens on a 33MM Camera. He focuses in on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron CLICKS off numerous Photos of them. And then CLICKING all the various Klansmen enjoying the outing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: focusing in on his Targets: CLICKING! Walter, Ivanhoe, Fe all of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flip nears the Target area seeing something that makes hi laugh out loud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gezzus H. Christ!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Targets are...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: in the form a Black Silhouette of a Running Black Man wit Afro, Big Lips, Butt, etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helps with practicin' for Nigger Looters. Dem' Sum-bitches Run like Roaches when you Flip the switch in the Kitchen late at Night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Felix and Ivanhoe shoot their Hand Guns at the Black Man Targets! They HIT The Bulls-Eye targets on his Head, Lips Butt, Body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know how that Black Bastard got away the other day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ivanhoe suddenly pipes up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Ron! Take my Forty-Five Auto wanna see what you can do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you'll get dat Nigger next time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ivanhoe hands Flip his pistol. He takes it, his hand swea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALL EYES ON FLIP as he takes aim at a Black Man Running Target Fifty Feet away. The Klansmen observing. BANG!!! A Hole rips in the Black Man Target Head!!! Then the Butt!! Body! And Lips!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good Shot!!! Shit! Got that Coon Dead in The Ass! Nice One!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's one deaaaaaad Jungle Bunny!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Gang eyes Flip, impressed. Ivanhoe pats Flip's back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where'd you learn to shoot like that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My Ole Man gave me a Toy Cap Gun when I was a Kid, been shooting ever since.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ivanhoe proceeds to teach Flip the Klan handshake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone is gone now. Ron walks through observing The Sce looking over the remnants of the gathering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron picks up the Official Running Nigger Target full of Bullet Holes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrice and Ron walk on a Nature Pathway alongside a Cree

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bernie Casey's a Badd Brother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cleopatra Jones was the one. It's about time We see a strong Sister like that...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...And Tamara Dobson played a Cop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was a Black Exploitation Movie. A fantasy. Real life's not like that. In real life there's no Cleopatra Jones or Coffy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't dig Pam Grier? She's Fine as Wine and twice as Mellow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pam Grier is doing her Thing but in real life it's just Pigs killing Black Folks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if a Cop was trying to make things better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the inside?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, from the inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't make things better from the inside. It's a Racist System.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So just give up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!!! We fight for what Black People really need! BLACK LIBERATION!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't you do that from the inside!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! You can't. White Man won't let us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron gets frustrated. Patrice stops him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did Dubois say about "Double Consciousness"? "Twoness". Being an American and a Negro? Two Souls? Two Thoughts? Two warring ideals in one Dark Body?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know how that feels. I'm Two damn people all the time!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you shouldn't be! We shouldn't have a War going on inside ourselves. Why can't we just be Black People?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because we're not there yet!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'm tired of waiting!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrice walks off. Ron sighs, walks to catch up to her, a puts his arm around Patrice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shaft or Superfly?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pick one, Shaft or Superfly?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Private Detective over a Pimp any day and twice on Sundays.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard Roundtree or Ron O'Neal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard Roundtree. Pimps Ain't No Heroes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron O'Neal isn't a Pimp. He's just playing one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That image does damage to Our People.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JESUS CHRIST!!! Give it a rest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't you JIVE TURKEY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both LAUGH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Knocking at the door. Ron opens it and finds Felix standi there. The two stare at each other for a moment, finally.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wrong address.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Felix backs away as Patrice peeks from around Ron seeing Felix. Felix sees her, turning to walk away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who was that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron watches Felix drive away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ivanhoe, Walter and Felix are in the kitchen talking, drinking beer and eating snacks. Flip enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, sorry had to work late. How you guys doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone greets Flip, but Felix says. Flip grabs a beer f a cooler, pops the tab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got a Twin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone goes quiet looking at Flip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got a Twin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twin what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Twin-Twin and ya Twin is a NIGGER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flip looks dumbfounded. Felix nears him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looked in the Phone Book and went over what I thought was your place and found a Nig there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Felix looks deadly. Ivanhoe and Walter look at Flip. Fina

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My number's unlisted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Felix just continues to stare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What address did you go to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over on... Bluestem Lane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't live on Bluestem. I live off 21st Street...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you don't know that Nigger?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, that's that Nigger I keep in the woodpile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone laughs. Felix finally cracks a grin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 1813 South 21st Street. Come by sometime we'll have a Coors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ivanhoe and Flip clink cans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And y'know what? That loud mouth Black Student Union Bitch that's been in the paper complaining about the Police. She was there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That Fuckin' Cunt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like to close those Monkey Lips permanently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, after I get em' 'round da Head of my Dick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone laughs, agreeing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron takes a letter out of his Mailbox and excitedly rips A Letter from the KKK National Office. He grins and claps hands!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flip stands looking at what looks like a Credit Card as R sits at his desk, leaning back, satisfied.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you Fucking kidding me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't cross those lines. This is about an Investigation. Not a... Relationship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right, I'm messin' up. Hate to violate that Blue Wall of Silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is Patrice a Target?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron goes quiet, concerned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An excited Ron goes to the once stark empty white walls n covered with numerous Klansmen Photos. Ron SLAPS the Phot of Active Duty Soldiers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got Active Duty Soldiers from Fort Carson. Going to the CID with this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron SLAPS the photo of Steve and Jerry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our Mystery Boys Steve and Jerry. Still don't know who they are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron SLAPS photos of Felix, Ivanhoe, Connie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got Felix's Old Klan Crew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron turns to Flip and he SLAPS a photo of Walter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we got new Klan Walter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter's a General without an Army. Felix's Crew is stronger than him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flip looks at Ron, amazed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've really been talking to Devin Davis?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh Hell yeah!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron SLAPS The Large Photo of Devin Davis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's my Ace Boon Coon Running Partner! And now that you got that Ronny Boy. We are on a Roll, Baby!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron laughs and points at the KKK Membership Card and Flip picks it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE on the card as Flip reads it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Member in Good Standing Knights of the Ku Klux Klan

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's us The Stallworth Boys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, funny, but you didn't have psychopath staring at you asking where you lived.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I called to warn you, but you must have already taken off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron, I wasn't raised Jewish. It wasn't a part of my Life. So I never thought much about being Jewish, was just another White Kid, didn't even have my Bar Mitzvah. No Chanukah for me. Christmas. In this job, you try to keep things at a distance. You put up a Shield so you don't feel anything... This shit is deep. When that Fuck Felix had me in that room and I kept having to deny my heritage...I have been passing. OMITTED.  OMITTED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron drives up and gets out of his Car and walks up meetin Patrice, Odetta, Hakeem and other Members of the Black Student Union outside holding flyers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrice stands there looking very upset, she shoves a Fly out at Ron. He takes it, reads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A drawing of a Hooded and Robed Klansman. Above the Drawi there's Text: You Can Sleep Tonight Knowing The Klan Is Awake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where'd you find them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I found this one on my Car. But they're all over The Neighborhood, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron looks around seeing Residents and Students holding th Flyers, discussing them, some upset, others bewildered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think this is Real?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Real.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hakeem, Odetta and the Others look around for them, pisse

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is intimidation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clearly, this is about the Black Student Union and you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've been outspoken about the incident with the Police when Brother Kwame was here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So the next time they'll have a Burning Cross out Front.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're trying to get to you, like you said they want to intimidate make themselves feared. If you don't let 'em scare you. They got nothing. But keep your eyes open. Be Cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the problem we've been too Cool!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Way too Cool!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe the both of you should call The Cops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How we know this ain't some of the KKK's Honky-Pig-Partners passing out this Shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrice and Ron step away from Odetta and Hakeem. They wa and talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Fleet of Pickups rides uphill. A Flat Bed on the end of Convoy has an Eighteen-Foot Wooden Cross fastened on it. A CSPD Patrol Car drives past The Convoy, headed downhill

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ivanhoe, riding with Flip, watches The Patrol Car pass in opposite direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soak the Wood in Kerosene, we light a Cig on a pack of matches. Gives us time to Beat It before The Cross catches Fire. Safeguard against CSPD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Must be quite a sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Best. You can see it for Miles. Freaks out The Jew Media and puts Niggers on their Nigger Toes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They ride in silence for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lot of these Guys in The Army?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, even got a few in Active Duty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just finished my Second Tour in Nam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ivanhoe's eyes light up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah? Know anything about C-4?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enough to make shit BLOW UP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flip stops talking. He might've revealed a bit too much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron watches as Walter and Felix argue through Night Visio Binoculars. Ron says on the Walkie-Talkie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Send another one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another Patrol Car passes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn, that's The Second One. Pigs are out tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Convoy crests The Hill, pulls to The Side of The Road

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Klansmen dismount and gather around The Flatbed Truck carrying the Wooden Cross.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another CSPD Patrol Car appears. It passes by, not slowin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That makes Three Piggy Wiggys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone stops what they're doing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Felix turns and catches Flip's eye. It almost seems as if he's staring directly at Flip...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: lowers them, grins to himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good job, Men.

dialogues.speaker: THE PICKUP TRUCKS
dialogues.text: Peeling out, heading back down The Hill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrice comes outside and gets in the Car taking off. Fel has been watching her the whole time sitting in his pick truck. He spits, tosses his cigarette and follows her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's late. Ron's alone on the phone in mid-conversation. is intercut with Devin Davis speaking on the sofa in his

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I don't share this with many people, but My family had a Colored Housekeeper growing up. Her name was Pinky. She was probably the closest Woman to me other than Mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That surprises me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. People think I hate Negroes. I don't and The Organization doesn't either.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron gives a "This Is Crazy!" Look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They just need to be with their own. That's what Pinky would say, she had no problem with Segregation because she wanted to be with her own kind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds like she was a Mammy to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was. You ever see "Gone with the Wind"? Pinky was my Hattie McDaniel. She won an Oscar for Best Supporting Actress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were Scarlett and she was Mammy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right. When she passed away it was like we lost one of the Family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A good Nigger's funny that way. In that sense they're like a Dog. They can get real close to you and when you lose em'. Just breaks your heart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well said Ron.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew a Nigger once.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didja?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Nigger lived across the street from us. I must of been Six or Seven. His nickname was Butter Biscuit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd he get that nickname?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He loved his Mama's Butter Biscuits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yum Yum!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me and Butter Biscuit played together everyday. One day My Father came home early from work and told me I couldn't play with him anymore because I was White and Butter Biscuit was a Nigger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Davis laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's rich.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron's face reveals the story is probably true, but revers

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ain't it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your Father sounds like a Terrific Man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, Buddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you're an upstanding White Christian Man. I tell you this is why we need more people like us in Public Office. To get this Country back on Track.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For America to Achieve our Greatness... again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely. Sure wish we had the chance to chat Face to Face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In due time, my friend, in due time. I'll be in Colorado Springs for your initiation...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll be in Colorado Springs?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You bet your Mayflower Society Ass I will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron smiles and takes a SMALL NOTE PAD from his jacket poc and writes something down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrice sits in front of a MICROFILM READER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her Face is covered with EMOTION as she rolls through the ghastly photos of BLACK LYNCHINGS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron is alone at his desk. He is on the Undercover Phone L

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need a new Leader. Someone everyone can unite behind. Felix would Love to be The One but we can't let that happen. He's a Crazy Sonofvabitch. A Loose Cannon. We need someone Articulate, who displays Great Leadership qualities...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It should be you, Ron. You should be Chapter President. You!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron sits there a moment, unable to say a word. After he COMPOSES HIMSELF:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That would be quite an Honor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will be Great...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll have to think about this. My father is very ill and he lives in El Paso. I won't have the time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a Smart and Diligent Man. I've got no doubt you could handle it. OMITTED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Car's parked across The Street from Felix's House. Ro listens in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Whole Chapter is present. Half of them are open-carry In a corner, Ivanhoe teaches Flip the historic Klan handshake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE - Index and Middle Finger extended along The Inside Wrist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it's time for some new Blood to get in here. I'm planning to step down as your President.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Members exchanged looks. Felix can't hide his smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like to make a nomination... Mr. Ron Stallworth for Chapter President.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Room is Silent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We just met this Guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He just walked in off the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me ask a question. Is there anybody here that is willing to put their Neck on the Line for Ron?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will vouch for Ron.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All eyes turn to Flip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a Big Honor but I can't accept. Problem is, what you Good Men need is a President who will be constant, on CALL Day In, Day Out. I'll be back and forth between here and Dallas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron on headphones squints, WORRIED, saying to himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: El Paso, Flip, El Paso...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dallas? I thought it was El Paso.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rest of the Chapter Members are paying attention now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did I say Dallas?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron which One is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make up your mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The whole Room waits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dallas is where my Plane layover is. El Paso is where my sick Father is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They buy it. We think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dallas, where they killed that Nigger Lover Kennedy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where you learned that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can read.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Chapter chatters in agreement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just hope my Father isn't cared for by some Texicano Spic Nurse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Collective moans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll pray for ya Pop's health.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Big Spic Teets!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron is on the Undercover Phone Line. Sgt. Trapp sits behi him. Ron has his Receiver out so that Trapp can listen in

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm anxious to meet you and it will be something I share with my Family for Generations to come.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm eager to meet you too, Ron.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron and Sgt. Trapp make eye contact. Sgt. Trapp nods, a l threatening to spring out of his Face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say, Mr. Davis... I just have to ask. Aren't you ever concerned about some Smart-Aleck Negro calling you and pretending to be White?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sgt. Trapp covers his Mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I can always tell when I'm talking to a Negro.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How so?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take you, for example. I can tell you are a pure Aryan White Man by the way you pronounce certain words.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sgt. Trapp is doubled over now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any examples?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take the word "are". A pure Aryan like you or I would say it correctly... like "are". Negroes pronounce it "are-uh".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are so White... Right. I want to thank you for this Lesson because if you had not brought it to my attention, I would never have noticed the difference between how We talk and how Negroes talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sgt. Trapp is laughing so hard he is shaking violently. H shakes his head as if to implore Ron to stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From now on I'm going to pay close attention to my Telephone conversations so I can make sure I'm not talking to one of dem' Sneaky Coloreds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron cups The Receiver, looks at Sgt. Trapp, whispers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sgt. Trapp gets up and bumbles away. Ron speaks into The PHONE:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would love to continue this conversation when you are in Colorado Springs. Beautiful here, Sir. God's Country.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I've heard, Ron. You have a nice day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You too, Sir. God Bless White America.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron hangs up, laughing. He calls to Sgt. Trapp:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's over!!! You can come back!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then-- The Undercover Phone rings. Ron hesitates. It strange timing. He picks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Felix.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron quickly cups The Receiver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Catch you at a bad time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not at all. Just... finishing a Meal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meeting. My House. Now. Git ya Ass in gear and don't tell Mealy Mouth Walter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flip looks down at a Steel Door built into The Ground, it latch left open. He looks around. Paranoid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flip enters The Short Stairwell, steps to The Cement Floo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome to The Promised Land.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Room is Tight. Military Outfits hang from The Wall, surrounding The Group of Klansmen, who sit on Milk Crates the corner, a Sniper Rifle rests on a swivel near Boxes o Canned Goods and Stacked Cots.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flip finds an empty Crate, Squats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Felix stands underneath a single hanging Light-Bulb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In about a week's time, we will be welcoming Mr. Davis to our City.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Felix lets that hang in The Air for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's packing tonight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ivanhoe goes upside his head with his handgun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm packed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One by one, Brothers brandish Weapons. Except Flip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's your Piece, Ron?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't carry it on me All The Time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Chapter Members laugh teasingly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got ya covered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Won't happen again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Felix reaches behind his back, pulls out a Sharpe & G .45 caliber and hands it to Flip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're gonna need your Good Shot come next Sunday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's gonna happen next Sunday?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat. Felix regards the rest of the Men with gravity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The War is gonna come to us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck ya'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Felix grins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like we got ourselves another Soldier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just make sure that when you're at The Steakhouse, you've got your new friend with Ya.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And give it a name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Felix and Connie are in bed, she is lying on his chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, you ever have second thoughts?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Killin' 'em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never think twice about Killin' Niggers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Won't be able to take it back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're da' first of many Niggers that must die, Honey Bun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. It's just... becoming so real. It's always seemed like a dream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Felix sits up, reflecting, proud and determined.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. It's just so beautiful. We're cleansing this Country of a backwards Race of Monkey's. First the Spooks then the Kikes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Felix sits up raising his hand like Martin Luther King.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Free at last! Free at Last! Thank God a'mighty - Free a' dem Niggers At Last!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They chuckle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love when you do that, Honey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Connie looks into his eyes, also reflective.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, we've talked about killing Niggers for so many years and now it's really happening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My Old Man always told me good things come to those who wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She touches the side of his face, very loving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you for bringing me into you Life. For loving me like you do and giving me a purpose, direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Y'know, this will be the Shot heard around The World.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The New Boston Tea Party.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey Bun, one day, The Great Historians will write about us like that. They'll say we were the Patriots that saved America. You and me. We turned the Tide. Saved our True White Race... it fact, saved an entire Nation and brought it back to its Glorious Destiny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a way, we're The New Founding Fathers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This strikes Felix. He sits there soaking it in. He final turns to Connie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes we are... Martha.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indeed we are... George.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Couple Kiss each other passionately.  106   OMITTED  107   OMITTED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron arrives. Sits at his Desk. A deep sigh. But then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sees something. On his Desk. A Simple Note:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron's Car is parked, and another Car drives up and parks across from him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AGENT Y - (40's) in a Suit - gets out the car and Ron fol suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Stallworth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agent... Y?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Names of Chapter Members?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agent Y shows Ron a folder and runs his Finger down The L and suddenly stops. He then continues going down The List then stops again. He pulls out a Small Ledger and makes a note.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agent Y turns back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two Names on your list work at NORAD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Two Mystery men. Steve and Jerry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their real names are Harry Dricks and Kevin Nelson. Two Clowns with Top Security clearances. These Klansmen are in charge of monitoring our Safety.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agent Y lets this sink in. Even Ron is surprised by this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've done a Service to your Country.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agent Y slips Ron a folder full of Papers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've been monitoring your Investigation. Impressive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron flips through the Papers. Various documents about The History of The Colorado Klan. Agent Y takes a thoughtful pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last night, Fort Carson reported several C4 Explosives missing from their Armory. No suspects.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Klan...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agent Y doesn't say anything. Not confirming, not denying

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We thought they might pull something. But not like this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You won't see this on the News. For obvious reasons but I thought it might be of interest to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agent Y rises to his feet. Ron rises as well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you know about an attack, I need to know when.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the one with the Impressive Investigation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agent Y walks to his car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But... can't you, The FBI pitch in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agent Y gets in his car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Federal Bureau of Investigation?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron just looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because we never had this conversation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agent Y drives off. Felix and Flip are alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flip, I'm starting to trust you. I'm gonna tell you something none of our Brothers know. My lil' sister married a Nigger. Now I got a lil' Nigger Niece and a lil' Nigger Nephew. Jesus Christ, The World's going to Hell in a Handbasket! Do me a favor, don't tell nobody. Cuz' if you do, I'm gonna have to shoot you dead. I'm serious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for sharing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron and Patrice are going at it on the Porch. The Freedom House Protestors assemble on the street to March on the K

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can hate me all you want to, just promise me you won't go to The Protest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going. We're going. What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't say specifics but today, The Klan is planning an Attack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then we have to tell The People.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not an option.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one can know while it's an Active Investigation...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Active Investigation? And pray tell how do you know all this? You a Cop?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not a Cop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you, then?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron takes a moment. Then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I'm a Undercover Detective. I've been investigating The Klan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuckin' KKK? Ron Stallworth, you lied to me. Is that even your real name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron Stallworth is my first and last name. Today's not the day...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I take my Duties as President Of The Black Student Union seriously. What is this all about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the good it does. You could sit in the middle of Nevada Avenue and set yourself on Fire and The Klan will still be here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd be doing something. Unlike you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unlike Me? Don't think because I'm not wearing a Black Beret, Black Leather Jacket and Black Ray Bans screaming "KILL WHITEY" doesn't mean I don't care about my People.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrice takes this in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That night we saw Brother Kwame... were you Undercover then too?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrice...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Answer the question. Were you Undercover The Night we met?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron is silent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron Stallworth are you for Revolution and The Liberation of Black People?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a Undercover Detective for The Colorado Springs Police Department. It's my J-O-B.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: House Niggers said they had J-O-B-S too. You disgust me. OMITTED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Butch is on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INTERCUT WITH BUTCH. Ron on the phone with Butch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The March?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll know soon enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLICK! Ron hangs up the phone, dreading this. He turns to Sgt. Trapp and Flip who have been standing there, listeni

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Felix just said the March was cancelled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All Ron can do is shake his head. He paces, concerned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could be all the Death Threats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're used to that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And there's been nothing more about explosives?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chief Bridges walks in unexpectedly with Landers. Everyon snaps up, respectful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I have a Special Assignment for Ron.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron already has an assignment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's more important than preventing an Attack?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chief Bridges hands Ron "The Devin Davis Death Threat Fax

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are very credible threats to Devin Davis's Life. Ron, I'm assigning you to be Security Detail for Davis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Shockwave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think that's a wise decision...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Davis needs protection. There's no one else available.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron, it's Nut Cracking Time. Put your Personal Politics aside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chief, it's not about that and you know it. Devin Davis and Ron have been speaking over the phone, several times. If he recognizes his voice... or if any of The Klansmen do, it could compromise Our Entire Investigation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Clusterfuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHIEF BRIDGES curls a smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Correct me if I'm wrong but didn't you boast that you were fluent in both English and Jive?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron is quiet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you remember that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Answer The Chief!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron goes at Landers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man, who you think you're talking to. You've been trying to sabotage me since Day One.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentlemen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why you getting so worked up, Boy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who you callin' Boy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chief raises his eyebrows from the comment. A pissed Mast Patrolman Landers turns to Chief Bridges for support but says nothing. Landers then Exits. Chief says to Ron.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you let him get to you that easy, you ain't got a Shot with Devin Davis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron takes his SMALL NOTE PAD out and writes something dow again. Chief Bridges looks at him confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A work light shines over them. WALKER, 40's, a tattooed E Con and Demolitions Expert, instructs Felix, Ivanhoe and Connie. They stand around a large work bench in the garag He carefully removes a large C4 Bomb from his gym bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen up. First, The Primary Target.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walker speaks to Connie. He sets The Bomb on the work ben

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Felix says you're doing it. So all you have to do is set the pocketbook on the front porch, back porch, side wall, doesn't matter. It just has to be against the building. You can plant it anywhere. There's enough C4 here to take the whole thing out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walker hands the C4 to Felix.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be careful with that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Understand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Felix hands the C4 to Connie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All you have to do when you've placed it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walker puts his Finger on the Toggle Switch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...is flip this switch. That's it. Got it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walker passes the detonator to Felix, who passes it to Connie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss Black Student Union Bitch is bringing in some Old Coon to speak. The place should be packed. So Walker, nothing but rubble...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...And Barbecue Niggers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ivanhoe laughs, liking that. Walker carefully removes ano Smaller Bomb from the bag. He can hold it in one hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what happens if that don't work?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plan B.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you handle it, Honey?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can count on me. I've been waiting to do my part.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gives her a peck on the lips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lovebirds. Get a Hotel Room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Connie puts the C-4, Smaller Bomb and Detonator into her Pocketbook. Ivanhoe reaches for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I feel it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!!! No feel!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron still in plain clothes parks his unmarked car in the of The Luxurious Antlers Hotel on South Cascade Ave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks toward the entrance, where the Six Bikers stand around Davis' Sedan. The Bikers all look up simultaneousl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Mr. Davis' Security Detail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look at each other, then back at Ron. They say nothi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then Davis emerges from The Hotel, wearing a neatly pressed Suit and Tie. He nods to the Bikers, then looks u the Plainclothes Black Detective in front of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron steps forward, extending a hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Mr. Davis. I'm a Detective from The Colorado Springs Police Department and I will be acting as your Bodyguard today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Davis smiles and shakes Ron's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Detective, pleased to meet you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As you may know, there have been several credible Threats against your Well-Being.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter and Ivanhoe walk outside The Hotel seeing Ron stan with Devin Davis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Da Heck's going on here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are Threats on my Life. This Detective has been assigned as my Bodyguard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter and Ivanhoe smile broadly. Ron changes his VOICE slightly for Walter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me be clear, Mr. Davis: I do not agree with your Philosophies. However I am a Professional and I will do everything within my means and beyond to keep you safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Davis stands there a moment, processing all of this. Mayb he's heard that voice somewhere before? Then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I appreciate your Professionalism.  OMITTED  OMITTED  OMITTED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BIKERS that look like Hells Angels Types lead a Motorcade through the streets of Colorado Springs with Two Vans beh them.  OMITTED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Van pulls up and the Door is RIPPED open. Walter stan there, big smile on his face as Flip steps out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry for the Extra Security today. Can't be too careful. Ready to meet Mr. Davis?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flip follows Walter to a large Table near the back, where Felix, Ivanhoe and other Chapter Members stand around chatting with Devin Davis. Everyone stands in line in awe of The Grand Wizard to sha his hand. Davis turns and smiles as Flip approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Davis, our newest recruit, Ron Stallworth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shakes both of their Hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron, it's my pleasure to finally meet you in person.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both of Davis' hands clasp Flip's hand tight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You as well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Davis pauses a moment as he processes Flip's voice. Is th the same person he's been talking to on the phone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Davis SLAPS Flip on the back appearing like best buddies. stands in the Background.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room filled with People mingling eating Hors d'oeuvre Walter stands between Flip and Davis as he holds Court.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flip, Ivanhoe, Walter, Felix and Connie all drink it up totally impressed and star struck. Felix does a double ta when he sees Ron.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuckin' Cop assigned to guard Mister Davis. Isn't that the livin' Shits?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody, it is time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Felix stares at Ron, pondering the door meeting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You stay here. Ya hear?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mood now Solemn and Deadly Serious and Religious. Fli and Ten other INDUCTEES stand in a cramped waiting room. all wear Klan robes and White Lone Ranger Masks. The othe inductees are grinning ear to ear, like Kids on Early Mor Christmas. JESSE NAYYAR steps in. Jesse is 35, Clean-Shaven, in shap underneath his flowing Klan robe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Jesse Nayyar, Colorado's Grand Dragon. I welcome you all to this Sacred Ceremony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse stands tall, beaming. Flip wipes his brow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a moment you will take a Life Oath to join the most Sacred Brotherhood this Nation has ever seen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse allows for a dramatic pause. Davis addresses them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My Brothers in Christ, Nobel Prize recipient and Co-Creator of the Transistor and my dear friend, William Shockley, whose Scientific work ushered in the Computer Age, has proven through his Research with Eugenics that each of us have flowing through our veins the Genes of a Superior Race. Today, we celebrate that Truth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flip and the others stand strong and ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hoods on, Gentlemen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Inductees take off the Masks and put on their Hoods, covering their Faces. Flip hesitates, then pulls his hood

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron sees a Black WAITER, JOSH, 50, and nears him, whisper in his ear. The Waiter looks around and gestures for Ron follow him. Ron follows Josh up a back set of stairs. He points to a door and Ron SLAPS twenty dollars in his hand Josh leaves. Ron goes through the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron enters the small storage room full of Janitorial supplies. He looks through a small window down at the Pri Room below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The House is filled to capacity watching Patrice speak at podium as JEROME TURNER, Black, 90 Years Young, a distinguished Gentleman, sits across from her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am extremely honored today to introduce our speaker for today Mister Jerome Turner. Mr. Turner was born in 1898 in Waco, Texas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Inductees step inside a dark room lit only by Candles Devin Davis' Voice, ghostly, Calls from The Darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God... give us True White Men. The Invisible Empire demands strong Minds, Great Heart, True Faith, and ready hands...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Inductees align themselves in a row.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Men who have Honor. Men who will not Lie. Men who can stand before a Demagogue and damn his treacherous flatteries without blinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flip can see Davis now, illuminated by Candles, wearing h own Ceremonial Robe. His Hood does not cover his Face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turner is at the Podium. He speaks slowly but with streng

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was a nice spring day, Waco, Texas May 15th, Nineteen Hundred and Sixteen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flip looks around and the Room comes into Focus: He is surrounded, on all sides, by Klansmen wearing Robes and H and holding Candles. It's a Surreal, Hair-Raising experie

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse Washington was a friend of mine. He was Seventeen, I was Eighteen. He was what they called back then, Slow. Today it's called Mentally Retarded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They claim Jesse Raped and Murdered a White Woman named Lucy Fryer. They put Jesse on Trial and he was convicted by an All White Jury after deliberating for Four Minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God give us real Men, Courageous, who flinch not at Duty. Men of Dependable Character, Men of Sterling Worth. Then Wrongs will be Redressed and Right will Rule The Earth. God give us True White Men!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence. Then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron Stallworth, come forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron looks down from the window. Flip steps toward Davis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was working at the Shoe Shine Parlor. After the verdict, a Mob grabbed Jesse, wrapped a Chain around his Neck and dragged him out the Court House.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew I had to hide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron Stallworth. Are you a White, Non- Jewish American Citizen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flip is breathing hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am a White, Non-Jewish American Citizen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tears roll down her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Attic of the Parlor had a Small Window and I watched below as The Mob marched Jesse along Stabbing and Beating him. Finally, they held Jesse down and cut his Testicles off in Front of City Hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Police and City Officials were out there just watching like it was a 4th of July Parade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Davis looks into Flip's Eyes. Flip returns The Stare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you in favor of a White Man's Government in this Country?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Candles from The Ceremony reflecting in the window in fro of Ron's face as he watches The Madness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They cut off Jesse's Fingers and poured Coal Oil over his Bloody Body, lit a Bonfire and for two hours they raised and lowered Jesse into the Flames over and over and over again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE - Flip stands there holding in his emotions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mayor had a Photographer by the name of Gildersleeve come and take Pictures of the whole Lynching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron Stallworth. Are you willing to dedicate your Life to the Protection, Preservation and Advancement of the White Race?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Horrific, Barbaric, Simply Unreal!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Devin Davis holds an Aspergillus in one Hand, a Bowl of W in the other Hand. The Inductees drop to their knees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In Mind, in Body, in Spirit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Davis sprinkles Water on each Inductee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More Lynching Photos!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Pictures were sold as Post Cards. They put Jesse's charred Body in a Bag and dragged it through Town then sold what was left of his remains as Souvenirs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLAPPING and CHEERING from the Audience filled with Pride The Inductees on their Feet. The End of The Ceremony. Wives and Parents are crying with Joy. Children watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good White Folks cheered and laughed and had a High Ole' Time. They estimate close to Fifteen Thousand people watched it. They brought The Children out on Lunch hour from School. All I could do was Watch and Pray they wouldn't find me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MORE LYNCHING PHOTOS of The Enormous Crowd. No one Hides their Faces. Everyone is proud to be there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Crowd at the Lecture is Destroyed by The Story. Peopl are Weeping, Tears streaming down faces, Odetta and Hakee sit there, stunned. Patrice her Eyes Red with Tears leads audience around the room examining the LYNCHING PHOTOS th are on display.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron sees Flip's Ceremony completed and goes downstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lights are now on, The Candles extinguished, The Hood have been removed. Everyone sits watching as D.W. Griffit The Birth of a Nation is projected on a Screen. The newly installed Klansmen and their Families watching the Film w faces of amazement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of the reasons they did that to Jesse was that Birth of a Nation Movie had come out a year before. It gave The Klan a Rebirth. It was what was a Big, Big thing back then. Today what they call a Blockbuster! Everybody saw it. They say even The President of The United States, Woodrow Wilson showed the Movie in the White House, he said "it was History written with Lighting".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Davis, Flip, Felix, Ivanhoe, Walter and the others watch captivated. The Klan riding to the rescue defeating The B Beasts!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: observes it all from the back of the room, the only Black person there. He is like an Alien from Another Planet. OMITTED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a large space with a long banquet table. Walter welc Davis up to The Head Table podium.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please everyone rise as The Grand Wizard leads us in a toast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Davis steps to the podium raising his glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look around, today we are privileged to be among White Men such as yourselves, Real Warriors for The Real America, the One Our Ancestors Fought and Died for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone's face in the room brightens as Davis fills them with inspiration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are the True White American Race the Backbone from whence came Our Great Southern Heritage. To the USA!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone in the Hall shouts: TO THE USA! Everyone stands, hoisting their glasses upward. Ron can see Holsters-- on Belts, on Legs, on Ankles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron's mouth goes agape realizing Everyone in the Room is Armed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Devin Davis at the Banquet table shoves a forkful of Prim Rib into his mouth as he chats casually with Walter and Jesse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Felix and Connie sit near The Head Table, eating. Flip si on the opposite end. Ron watches as Connie rises from her seat. She leans down giving Felix a peck on his Cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: leaves the banquet hall and Ron watches her go out the fr door. Felix goes over to Davis, leaning down to greet him

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just want to say how Honored I am to be in your presence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They shake hands in the traditional Klan manner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Honor is Mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: walks through the maze of tables with his second helping food when he notices...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: talking at the table with Walter and Davis. Flip is very chummy laughing and telling stories with them like old friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walker stares hard at Flip like he's trying to place him. sits next to Felix, still staring at Flip. Walker nods to himself, speaking quietly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a Cop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That Guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Felix looks at Flip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, the other Guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walker is talking about Flip too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron's a Cop?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, his name is Phillip but his nickname is Flip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's Phillip?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walker looks at Flip as he speaks to Davis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's Ron, that's Phillip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the Fuck are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That guy was the Cop that sent me away to Prison for Armed Fucking Robbery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flip eating with Davis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His name is Phillip... Phillip Zimmerman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Felix is shocked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, he's a Fuckin' Pig.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's his name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phillip Zimmerman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't that a Jew name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know... probably.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So Ron Stallworth is a Fucking Jew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coulda' been worse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Felix looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coulda' been a Nigger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Felix thinks to himself, then looks over at  RON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: who is standing not far away from Devin Davis. Ron is WATCHING  FELIX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: and Walker focusing on Flip. The Two, Ron and Felix, shar long uncomfortable stare. Felix has figured it all out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a Nigger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walker turns to Felix.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That Cop guarding Davis. Zimmerman is using his name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's tell Davis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walker starts to rise, Felix lowers him back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not now, I'll find the moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Felix turns to Connie, whispering, they all then rise. Ro knows something is askew. He gives Flip a look. Flip sees as Ron walks over to Davis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Mr. Davis, a favor to ask. Nobody's gonna believe me when I tell them I was your Bodyguard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron holds up a Polaroid Camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Care to take a Photo with me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Davis laughs, looking around the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't see any harm in that. Hey Jesse... why don't you get in here too?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse Nayyar, equally amused, walks over. Flip is already of his Seat, walking to Ron. Ron glances over seeing

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Connie has her purse and Walker hands her a gym bag. Feli pecks her on the lips. She exits the steakhouse with the bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: then turns to Flip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mind taking it, Sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flip nods and Ron hands him The Polaroid Camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron walks back and stands in between Davis, THE GRAND WIZ and Jesse, THE GRAND DRAGON.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One... Two... Three!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right as the Camera Flashes, Ron drapes his arms around b Davis and Jesse, pulling them in real close. The Polaroid clicks and spits out the Photo instantly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Davis is startled for a brief second... then it all happe in a FLASH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
